Author: gjenkins01

Comment: I'm not sure you can call them anarchists, to be honest. Anarchism opposes capitalism because it sees the regimentation of society in service of capital as just that: a form of hierarchy that leads to oppression. Libertarians oppose government but revere capitalism. In practice, they don't seem to want to flatten social hierarchies, but rather to remove the state so they can construct new ones with them at the top.  Without the idea of an equal society it can't be anarchism, and if you expand the definition of libertarianism to also include those moderates who don't want to cripple or destroy the state in order to replace it with private hierarchies then there's no difference between them and classical liberals.
